segments.text: I see the boy stretching for the cookie jar, and it reminds me of my own childhood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s so brave, standing on that wobbly stool like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting so patiently, and I hope he shares with her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water overflowing, but the woman is too busy to see it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s funny how life goes on, even when little disasters are happening all around us.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, like nothing could ever go wrong there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to make it, but I’m not sure about the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying dishes like she’s in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever look up and see what’s really going on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so focused on the cookies that they don’t even notice the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they get away with it, but I also hope no one gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR
